CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 26, 1963, pg. 3, reads: "First Prize - West Penn Hospital patient Robert (Bob) Holloway views his painting of a winter scene which won first prize in hospital's contest. The artist was confined after a skidding accident in which he was thrown from his car, striking his head on a curb and causing concussion.  He is employed as an engineer at the hospital.  This marks the second straight year that a patient of Ward 130-B has won first prize. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Robert "Bob" Holloway wearing plaid robe and standing next to his prize winning landscape painting with horse and sleigh, at Western Pennsylvania Hospital
